title: Most natural way to enforce siblings synchronisation
body:
#### What is the problem?

I would like to enforce the synchronisation of a GitHub sibling and a SSH sibling in the most natural way.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

I have two siblings, `github` and `cluster`. The latter needs should be required to store all annexed files.
This is how they are created:

```python
datalad.api.create_sibling_github(
    name = 'origin',
    reponame = os.path.basename(ds.path),
    dataset = ds,
    github_organization = 'X',
    access_protocol = 'ssh',
    private = True
)

datalad.api.create_sibling(
    name = 'cluster',
    dataset = ds,
    target_url = url,
    publish_depends = 'origin',
    annex_wanted = 'include=*'
)
```

So changes can be published through:

```bash
datalad publish --to cluster
```

But I'd like to know if this can be improved:
 - what if someone does `datalad publish --to github` instead of cluster ? How to make it so that cluster will be pushed to as well ? I thought I could set publish_depends = 'cluster' on the github sibling, but this results in an infinite loop when publishing.
 - Is there anyway to make `datalad publish` (without any argument) publish to "cluster" by default ?
 - Is there anyway to embed the `cluster` sibling configuration in the `github` sibling, so that when the user installs the dataset from github, he can just `datalad get --from cluster` without configuring the `cluster` sibling ? 


#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.14.0

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

Yes, and it is very handy.
